website_summaries.verdict: This unique folding hardshell kayak is a masterpiece of portable design.
pros: it’s a solid hulled boat that packs into its own wheeled bag
cons: Even folded, it’s still quite bulky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boat for use and transportation
customer_reviews.text: 6'2" and he fits perfectly and comfortably. Easy to assemble and disassembled. Perfect for ocean or lake. We use it here in Florida in the intercoastal waterways. We take it all around. Fits in the back of our 4 door jeep along with everything else we need for the day including a second Oru kayak. We bought a cart to pull it around, it's just a little easier to take it more places. Would definitely buy again and when they add an insert to make it a tandem we will definitely be buying that as well.
customer_reviews.author: asunnysnowman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it 3 times. I am getting better at putting it together. I like the way it looks and handles. It attracts attention. People want to see how to put it together. I bought it so I could put it in my car to transport. I put it in my car in pieces because I can't lift the kayak and the bag together. I like that I can store it stacked and in the bag. It doesn't take much room.
customer_reviews.author: Macopo

customer_reviews.title: She's Perfect!!!!! :*D
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Pakayak! It's still here in the living room. She hasn't even touched water yet and I am sold! I put her together and it was pretty darn easy... I reckon carrying her downstairs is the only drawback but it still beats carrying a whole kayak! At 5'11 I feel snug in the cockpit, but the placement of the seat seems to really support my back, exactly where it really needs it! I was worried I may need to get a new seat for it but right now it feels as if I'm going to SHRED some water everywhere I go! My car trunk needs some permanent space cleared away so she can be ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Anarchrist

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Habanero-colored pakayak and love it! I've traversed lakes and rivers, not yet the ocean, and it has proven its worth. No leaks, easy set-up, and stows away safely inside my home. We will eventually be looking at a second one for my wife, so we can travel wherever together! While it's not cheap, it is worth every penny. I'm 5'11" and fit perfectly into the 'cockpit.' Any taller and it will depend on your leg length.
customer_reviews.author: Longhrnlax

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with my new yak, tracks great, easy to assemble. Only thing I would change is the seat. Added some cushioning, problem solved. I’m 5’4” and 150 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak
customer_reviews.text: Great kayak. It’s easy to set up and take apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jcyr

customer_reviews.title: Pakayak
customer_reviews.text: I liked it because it was easy to assemble, and disliked that it did not have enough leg room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: :)  Wow Wow Wow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for a wedding gift for my son and daughter in law. They are in LOVE!!! They stored them in their condo, they can fly them anywhere (with an oversized luggage fee) and bring them to places that may be harder to access with a conventional Kayak. You miss nothing of the conventional models either; they look and behave even better then a lot of regular ones. Customer service too is top notch. You WILL NOT be disappointed !!!!
customer_reviews.author: gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Tough, strong, fun and stores anywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a proud owner of the bluefin 14 for about a year and it has been wonderful! The structure of it is sound and it stays as dry inside as any other kayak I've used. The real benefit is that it can be easily stored in a closet or the birth of a sailboat. Truly a hard shelled kayak you can take anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Callahan

customer_reviews.title: The Pakayak is a pleasure to paddle
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to get out and kayak solo, and didn’t have a roof rack. I love this kayak - it is fun, easy to assemble, comfortable, fits in the back seat of my Corolla, a great boat that allows me the freedom to cruise our local waterways. I roll it in its case to the water’s edge and assemble it there, as it is heavy, but glides beautifully in the water. It’s allowed me to explore so many new places, and see our beautiful world from a new perspective 😊
customer_reviews.author: cassc

product_meta.title: Pakayak Bluefin 14 Ft Kayak, The Only Hardshell Packable Kayak - Packs Down into Included Rolling Bag That Fits Inside of Your Trunk! Nests into Itself for Ultimate Portability and Storage!
feature_bullets: PERFORMANCE - Using technologies from aerospace and underwater product designs, we’ve perfected the leak-proof rigid kayak. Rigid high density UV-resistant kayak-specific polyethylene. Double chined hull allows for carving, turning, surfing and control.
PORTABLE / PACKABLE - Assembled by anyone in less than 3 minutes with no small loose parts to lose. Store in your closet, fits in your trunk, take wherever you go.
DESIGN - Patented shape is modeled after the Bluefin tuna, one of the fastest fish on earth, makes the Bluefin 14 a stable, fast sea kayak. Leak-free guarantee!
CONSCIENTIOUS - Each model is named after an endangered marine species and a % of profits go to foundation to save that specific species. Proudly made in USA.

PRODUCT SPECIFICS - One-Person sit-in sectional rigid hull sea kayak that clamps together (6pcs) patented design 1200 lbs of force holding each section to the next. Two large watertight hatches for dry storage. Foam seat makes for a comfortable ride. 18"x34" cockpit fits XL spray skirts. Ballistic nylon bag with wheels. Assembled: 168”L x 24”W x 16”H / 427 x 61 x 41 cm, Nested: 42”L x 24”W x 16”H / 107 x 61 x 41 cm
